CR CR.CUST.OPPOR.HIST CR.CUST.OPPOR.HIST
This system generated table will monitor all opportunities communicated with the customer. It is necessary in order for the system to know whether a customer is already the target of a campaign on an earlier iteration, or has already been approached by the bank regarding a particular product, so that inappropriate opportunities can be prevented.
It can also be used in analysis of campaign/opportunity effectiveness, and also to monitor how many communications have been directed towards a customer over a set period of time.

First field of multivalue set. Each multivalue set will represent one product / product group / category that we have presented to the customer as an opportunity. This field will store the product initiated by the opportunity. This is principally for the prevention of duplicate opportunities being generated for the same customer.

: System Generated Noinput Field. An opportunity may represent a specific product, a product group or a specific category. If the opportunity is at the specific product level, the PRODUCT field would be populated - however, if the opportunity is at the higher 'product group' level, then this AA.PRODUCT.GROUP field would be populated. Only one of PRODUCT , AA.PROUCT.GROUP and CATEGORY can be populated.

Validation Rules
: System Generated Noinput Field.

This field will hold the Original direction of the CR.OPPORTUNITY. The system needs to monitor how many outbound opportunities are generated by the bank, to ensure 'over saturation' does not occur where the customer is contacted too many times. However, if an opportunity is initially 'INBOUND', i.e reliant on the customer contacting the bank, if it is changed to 'OUTBOUND' following interest from the customer, these opportunities should not be included in the overall count - hence over saturation relies on the Original direction, rather than the eventual direction of the opportunity.
Validation Rules
: System Generated Noinput Field.
